creator: lawrence@us.ibm.com
text:
During my build process, there is a jar task to create a new jar file and add 
some class files, excluding others.  Later in the process, there is another jar 
task to add additional files to the jar file.  At the completion of the build, 
the jar file only contains the files from the initial task.

<jar jarfile="jarname" basedir="path" update="yes">
  <include name="path1/*.class" />
  <exclude name="path1/class1.class" />
  <exclude name="path1/class2.class" />
</jar>
...
<jar jarfile="jarname" basedir="path" update="yes">
  <include name="path2/*.class" />
  <include name="path2/*.properties" />
</jar>

(Changing jarfile to destfile doesn't make any difference)

This process worked correctly with Ant 1.4.1, but it fails with Ant 1.5.1.  No 
error messages are provided, but the jar file only has the files from the first 
jar task.  

This occurs with Sun's 1.3.1 JDK and IBM's 1.3.1 JDK.
